ARABIC: إِذَا رَأَتْهُم مِّن مَّكَانٍۭ بَعِيدٍ سَمِعُوا۟ لَهَا تَغَيُّظًا وَزَفِيرًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: When it sees them coming from a long way off, they will hear it seething and rasping.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: When (Hell) appears to them from a distance they will hear it raging and roaring.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: When it will see them from afar, they will hear the sounds of its raging and roaring.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Even if they were to see [this fire] from a distant place, they would only listen to its raging and roaring.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: When it will see them from afar, they will hear its raging and roaring.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: When it sees them from a far place, they will hear its raging and its roaring.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: When it shall come into their sight from a distant place, they shall hear its vehement raging and roaring.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: When it sees them from a far place, they shall hear its bubbling and sighing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: When it seeth them from afar, they hear the crackling and the roar thereof.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: When it sees them from afar, they will hear its raging and roaring.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: When it beholdeth them from afar, they shall hear it raging and roaring.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: When it sights them from a distant place, they will hear it raging and roaring.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: When it sees them from a place far off, they will hear its fury and its ranging sigh.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: When it (Hell) sees them from a far place, they will hear its raging and its roaring.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: When it sees them from a far off place, they shall hear it raging and sighing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: When it sees them from a distant place, they will hear it raging and roaring.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: When the Hellfire sees them from a distant place, they will hear its fury and roaring.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [25:12] When it sees them from a distant place, they will hear it raging, boiling like an enraged person when his heart boils with anger, and roaring, [producing] a powerful noise. Alternatively, what is meant by their ‘hearing it raging’ is their vision of it and awareness of it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (When it) the Fire (seeth them from afar) from a distance of 500 years, (they bear the cracking) the exasperation which is akin to that of human beings (and the roar) similar to the braying of a donkey (thereof) coming from the Fire.
